Unknown Data - Mining & consolidating research dataset metadata on the web
AboutDissemenationEventsPeople

Cooperation Partners: The project is a cooperation of:

  • GESIS – Leibniz Institute for the Social Sciences (formerly Society of Social Science Infrastructure Institutions ) is a German research institute in the field of empirical social sciences. GESIS makes data sets and archives available to other researchers, making it a leading research infrastructure facility.

GESIS is part of the Leibniz Association and is funded by the federal and state governments. It is based in Mannheim and Cologne.

Project team members at GESIS:

Prof. Dr. Stefan Dietze Prof. Dr. Alexia Katsanidou
Dr. Brigitte Mathiak Yousef Younes
Chandrika Sundakampalayam Paramasivam
  • Schloss Dagstuhl – Leibniz Center for Informatics Since 1990, Schloss Dagstuhl, Leibniz Center for Informatics has organized informatics conferences of the highest scientific caliber. It also promotes and supports continuing and advanced academic education and the transfer of knowledge between academia and industry.

Dr. Marcel R. Ackermann
  • Humboldt University of Berlin, School of Library and Information Science

Prof. Dr. Robert Jäschke
